snippet: Germany’s constitutional court gave Chancellor Angela Merkel a significant victory in her bid to master the debt crisis that has buffeted Europe and endangered its common currency.
abstract: Federal Constitutional Court in Germany gives Chancellor Angela Merkel a significant victory in her bid to master the debt crisis, granting approval to one of the main pillars of her strategy; ruling allows the 17 European Union countries that use the euro to move ahead with the establishment of the European Stability Mechanism, that will handle bailouts and work in tandem with the European Central Bank.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS KULISH and MELISSA EDDY
byline.contributor: Nicholas Kulish reported from Karlsruhe, and Melissa Eddy from Berlin. Elisabetta Povoledo contributed reporting from Rome.

lead_paragraph: Germany’s constitutional court gave Chancellor Angela Merkel a significant victory in her bid to master the debt crisis that has buffeted Europe and endangered its common currency.

headline.seo: Merkel Victory as German Court Backs Euro Rescue Fund
headline.main: In Victory for Merkel, German Court Ruling Favors European Bailout Fund
headline.print_headline: In Victory for Merkel, German Court Ruling Favors European Bailout Fund
